properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-13T08:18:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-12T16:18:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1658368772.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Today, conditions are favourable to the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing heavy rain. Total rainfall amounts could reach up to 50 mm locally in the thunderstorms. Boaters may be surprised by strong gusts on bodies of water. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-13T04:59:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-12T15:25:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1848628054.2020

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:

Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Dense fog will continue in onshore winds. Intermittent improvement in visibility may occur, however, winds are expected to remain onshore until at least Monday. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms will start to develop along the foothills near noon and move eastwards through the day. The risk of severe weather will last until late this evening. This watch will likely be expanded later today. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-13T05:59:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-12T14:14:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4188345219.2020

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rainy weekend The remnants of tropical storm Fay will continue to affect the province of Quebec today. Rain associated with this system will give total rainfall amounts of 20 to 40 millimetres over some areas of Southern and Central Quebec. Nevertheless, some of these areas could receive total rainfall amounts exceeding 50 millimetres locally with the additional contribution of thunderstorms that may accompany this system. Precipitation will taper off during the day on Sunday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-13T01:06:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-12T09:07:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3868300012.2020

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Very warm weather is expected to continue. Time span: continuing until this evening. Maximum temperature today: near 27. Locations: Upper Lake Melville and Eagle River. Remarks: Very warm temperatures will continue today as the warm air mass persists over the region. Cooler temperatures are forecast beginning tonight. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please call HealthLine 811 for advice on health risks, symptoms and precautions associated with heat. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-07-13T01:59:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-12T13:49:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1824293825.2020
Area: Upper Lake Melville, Eagle River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. The remnants of tropical storm Fay will continue to affect the province of Quebec. Rain associated with this low pressure system will give total rainfall amounts exceeding 50 millimetres by tomorrow afternoon. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-12T19:25:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-12T03:26:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1995304735.2020

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Total rainfall: generally 35 to 45 mm with as much as 75 mm locally. Locations: Western Labrador and along the mid Labrador coast from Natuashish to Makkovik. Time span: today until mid day Monday. Remarks: The rain is expected to ease tonight in western Labrador and by mid day Monday along the coast. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-07-13T05:48:42-00:00

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. The remnants of tropical storm Fay continue to affect parts of the province of Quebec today. Rain associated with this low pressure system will give total rainfall amounts between 40 and 60 millimetres over Fermont and Schefferville. Precipitation will taper off this evening. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected.
